response.answer_text: Generally its is viewed as liberal. However, a Conservative or a Republican can be progressive as well. Teddy Roosevelt was a Republican but was also progressive and started Progressivism on a national scale; Ike was Republican and also progressive with several liberal initiatives; JFK was a progressive democrat but was also conservative with his tax cuts and expanded military ( both conservative policies). Terms are loosely used, and many times used inaccurately and ignorantly. The reality is that a Democrat and a Republican can be progressive without denying their general political leaning toward liberal or conservative—which ever the case may be. Progressive is a negative connotation by many conservatives and analogous to liberal in their view. Progressivism was actually started by the Republican Party. It does not have to be a negative connotation. The problem with progressivism is that it is a slippery slope that leads to Big Govt. and socialism. Balance is key as history so clearly teaches. People do not learn from their history and dogmatic ideology clouds objectivism. It is all or nothing for many people in our society; hence, the great dichotomy of liberal vs conservative battlefield we find ourselves in 2019. Of course, the PC Nazis brought much of this about too. It is a real mess and the end result will be very interesting. The swamp has become a raging tempest tossed sea; better get a really big boat!
